intro: Stiburus, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive silvery-gray leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Stiburus species are typically shrubs or small trees, with woody stems and compound leaves. They are adapted to arid environments and play a role in local ecosystems by providing shelter and food for various wildlife.
